reviewText: First part and second part was a lot better the man that played the warden bill boss over done the acting couldn't understand what he was saying because him screaming when he talked the DVD is not worth what they ask for the price it needs to be cheaper sorry

My DVD wouldn't  work  in a USA  region's  DVD player.. and  it  cost more  to return it  than what I  paid for it.
I've enjoyed these movies, but the acting in this one was horrible. The main actor in the first one just screams constantly. But the actual writing of the movie was great.

As sheer parody, this flick stands tall. It's a repudiation of humanity's history of inhumanity to their own species by an example of utmost depravity. Tom Six eruditely guides his assembled cast into a pit of sadism and torture where there is no surcease among a test sampling of society's worst and most disadvantaged. How much agony can any one human being endure? How much scorn, how much psychological enmity?

Dieter Laser plays his role magnificently, as well as the other cast members. I could have lived without seeing Laurence Harvey perform fellatio on one of the convicts, however. Other than that, and the raunchy homosexual aspects of what would be necessitated from such a female-excluded zone of a penitentiary; the monstrous violence presented explains sufficiently to me that in the dog-eat-dog world on either side of prison walls, it's the smartest policy to trust no one.
Thanks for having this!  I am proud to add this to my DVD collection!
